topic.title: How to Use the List Element

section.p: In order to create useful content, the list element will be quite necessary!

There are two main types of lists: unordered an ordered. Whichever list-type you choose is totally dependent on your content. For information that requires a step-by-step process, go for an ordered list, which requires the tag "<ol>." An unordered list is perfect for information that doesn't need to be presented in a particular order. In this next example, we'll look at how to create an unordered list.

As shown in the image above, you can see that a list does not need to go inside of a paragraph element; however, it should be inside of a section. The <ul> element shows what kind of list it will be, and inside of the code is where you start writing the information for the list items. Let's take a look at how to include each item in your list.
